## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a report with [Leads] type with name [MyLeadRPT]. If you don’t see any data in the preview area, click the All Time link to apply a standard filter that shows results for all time. Add a [standard filter] to select records whose [Lead Status] field [equals to] [Open - Not Contacted]. If the [Lead Status] field is not visible in the table, add it first.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open App Launcher, search for “reports,” and open Reports.
- Click New Report.
- In Report Type, search for “leads,” select Leads, and click Start Report.
- Clear default filters (Email, Street, Rating) if present.
- Add the Lead Status column:
  - Use Add Column search to find “lead status” and add it.
- Open Filters panel and add a standard filter:
  - Search/select Lead Status.
  - Set equals to “Open - Not Contacted” and Apply.
- Click Refresh to update the preview.
- Save the report:
  - Enter report name “MyLeadRPT” and click Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a report with [Opportunities] type named [HighValueDealsRPT]. If you don’t see any data in the preview area, click the All Time link to apply a standard filter that shows results for all time. Add a standard filter to select records whose [Amount] field is greater than [100,000]. If the [Amount] field is not visible in the table, add it first.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the report:
- Log in.
- Open App Launcher, search for “reports,” and open Reports.
- Click New Report.
- In the report type selector, choose All, search for “opportunities,” select Opportunities, and click Start Report.
- Open the Filters panel, add a filter for Amount:
  - Select Amount, set Operator to “greater than,” enter 100000, and Apply.
- Click Save, set Report Name to “HighValueDealsRPT,” and Save again.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used in the trajectory.

## Your ultimate task
```
Create a report using the Leads type and name it MyLeadRPT.
If no data shows up in the preview, click All Time so it includes results from all time.
Next, add a filter so it only shows records where Lead Status is set to Open – Not Contacted.
If you don’t see the Lead Status field in the table, make sure to add it first.
```
human_review_comment: rejected since it is the same. Rewriten

query_templated: Create a report with the Accounts type with name MyAccountRPT. Add a cross filter with the Opportunities object. Add a subfilter on stage field of the Opportunities object, which is set to equal to Prospecting and Need Analysis..
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a report with the [Accounts] type with name [MyAccountRPT]. Add a [cross filter] with the [Opportunities] object. Add a subfilter on [stage] field of the [Opportunities] object, which is set to [equal to] [Prospecting and Need Analysis.]
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open App Launcher, search for “Reports,” and open Reports.
- Click New Report, select the “Accounts” report type, and click Start Report.
- Open the Filters panel.
- Add Cross Filter: Accounts with Opportunities, then Apply.
- Add an opportunity subfilter: choose Stage, select Prospecting and Needs Analysis, then Apply.
- Click Save & Run, set Report Name to “MyAccountRPT,” and click Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a report with the [Leads] type named [QualifiedLeadsRPT]. Add a [cross filter] with the [Activities] object. Add subfilters on the [Status] field of the [Activities] object set to [equals Completed], and on the [Subject] field set to [contains Demo].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the report:

- Open Reports:
  - Open App Launcher, search for “Reports,” and open the Reports app/page.
  - Click New Report.
  - Select Leads (under the Leads category) and click Start Report.

- Add cross filter on Activities:
  - Open the Filters pane.
  - Open the Filters dropdown and choose Add Cross Filter.
  - Ensure the related object is Activities and apply.

- Add Activities subfilters:
  - Click Add Activities filter, choose Status, set to equals Completed, and apply.
  - Click Add Activities filter, choose Subject, change operator to contains, enter Demo, and apply.

- Save the report:
  - Click Save & Run.
  - Set Report Name to QualifiedLeadsRPT.
  - Click Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Let’s go ahead and build a report using the Accounts type and call it MyAccountRPT.
Next, add a cross filter that brings in the Opportunities object.
From there, apply a subfilter so it only shows opportunities where the Stage is Prospecting and Need Analysis.
```
human_review_comment: rejected since it is the same. Rewriten

query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a report with the Cases type with name UnimportantCasesRPT. Add following standard filters: [1. set Status field equals New 2. Set Date/Time Opened field greater than Last Week 3. Set Priority field equals Low 4. set Escalated field equals true.] Chain the filters with the logic filter with the formula [(1 OR 2) AND 3 NOT 4]. Save it to the public report.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce, open the App Launcher, search for “Reports,” and open the Reports app.
- Click “New Report,” select “Cases,” and click “Start Report.”
- Open the Filters panel and add these filters:
  1) Status equals “New”
  2) Date/Time Opened greater than “Last Week” (Use Relative Date: Last Week)
  3) Priority equals “Low”
  4) Escalated equals “True”
- Add filter logic and set it to: (1 OR 2) AND 3 NOT 4
- Click “Save & Run,” choose the “Public Reports” folder, name the report “UnimportantCasesRPT,” and save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a report with the Opportunities type with name ClosedOldBusinessOpportunitiesRPT. Add following standard filters: [1. set Stage field equals Closed Won 2. Set Stage field equals Closed Lost 3. Set Amount field Greater Than or Equal to 5000 4. set Type field equals New Customer.] Chain the filters with the logic filter with the formula [(1 OR 2) AND 3 NOT 4]. Save it to the public report.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Open Reports: Use App Launcher, search for “Reports,” and open it. Click New Report, select “Opportunities,” then Start Report.
- Add filters in the Filters panel:
  1) Stage equals “Closed Won” and Apply.
  2) Stage equals “Closed Lost” and Apply.
  3) Amount operator “Greater or equal” with value “5000” and Apply.
  4) Type equals “New Customer” and Apply.
- Add filter logic: Open Filters dropdown > Add Filter Logic, enter “(1 OR 2) AND 3 AND NOT 4” and Apply.
- Save to public folder: Click Save & Run, set Report Name to “ClosedOldBusinessOpportunitiesRPT,” choose “Public Reports” as the folder, and Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please spin up a Cases report named UnimportantCasesRPT. Add these standard filters, numbered as follows: 1) Status equals New 2) Date/Time Opened is greater than Last Week 3) Priority equals Low 4) Escalated equals true. Then apply this filter logic: (1 OR 2) AND 3 AND NOT 4. Save the report in the Public Reports.
```

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a summary report with the [Opportunities] type named [SalesByStageRPT] on the [Stage] field. Then create a [Bar chart] with a chart title [Opportunity Counts by Stage] and check the box for [Show Values].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan summary:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open App Launcher, search for and open Reports.
- Click New Report, select Opportunities, and Start Report.
- In Outline, add a group on the Stage field (group rows by Stage).
- Add a chart, set the chart type to Bar chart.
- Open Chart Properties:
  - Set Chart Title to "Opportunity Counts by Stage".
  - Check "Show Values".
- Save the report and name it "SalesByStageRPT".
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a summary report with the [Leads] type named [LeadSourceSummaryRPT] on the [Lead Source] field. Then create a [Funnel chart] with chart title [Leads by Source], put the legend on [bottom], and check the boxes for [Show Values] and [Show Percentages].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful Plan Summary

- Open Reports:
  - Log in, open App Launcher, search for “Reports,” and open the Reports app.
  - Click New Report, choose the Leads report type, and Start Report.

- Group by Lead Source:
  - Use Add Group and select Lead Source to group the report.

- Set filters:
  - Show Me: All Leads.
  - Created Date range: All Time.
  - Apply the filters.

- Add and configure chart:
  - Add Chart and open Chart Properties.
  - Set chart type to Funnel.
  - Chart Title: Leads by Source.
  - Enable Show Values and Show Percentages.
  - Set Legend position to Bottom.

- Save the report:
  - Click Save & Run.
  - Name the report LeadSourceSummaryRPT and Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Could you spin up a summary report on Opportunities named SalesByStageRPT, grouped by the Stage field? Then add a Bar chart titled "Opportunity Counts by Stage" and turn on Show Values.
```

query_templated: Build a matrix report of the Opportunities type with name OpptyMatrixByMonthType. Summarize on the Amount column with the SUM operation. Group row on the Close Month field and group column on the Type field. Save it to the public report.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Build a matrix report of the Opportunities type with name OpptyMatrixByMonthType. Summarize on the Amount column with the SUM operation. Group row on the Close Month field and group column on the Type field. Save it to the public report.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to build the matrix report (Salesforce Lightning):

- Navigate to Reports:
  - Open App Launcher, search for “Reports”, and open it.
  - Click New Report, choose report type “Opportunities”, then Start Report.

- Configure as a matrix:
  - Group Rows by Close Date, then set Group Date By to Calendar Month (Close Month).
  - Group Columns by Type.
  - Summarize the Amount column using Sum.

- Save and run:
  - Click Save & Run.
  - Name: OpptyMatrixByMonthType.
  - Select folder: Public Reports.
  - Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
- Adding both a row and a column grouping automatically creates a matrix report.
Sample 2:
TASK:Build a matrix report of the Accounts type with name AccountMatrixOwnerSite. Summarize on the Annual Revenue column with the Average operation. Group row on the Account Owner field and group column on the Account Site field. Save it to the public report.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to build the matrix report:

- Log in to Salesforce and open the App Launcher.
- Search for and open Reports.
- Click New Report, select Accounts as the report type, and click Start Report.
- Create a matrix layout:
  - Group rows by Account Owner (use Group Rows search to add “Account Owner”).
  - Group columns by Account Site (use Group Columns search to add “Account Site”).
- Add and summarize Annual Revenue:
  - Use the column search to add “Annual Revenue” if not already present.
  - Open Annual Revenue column actions > Summarize > choose Average.
- Save the report:
  - Click Save & Run.
  - Name: AccountMatrixOwnerSite.
  - Choose folder: Public Reports.
  - Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please create a matrix report based on Opportunities and name it “OpptyMatrixByMonthType.” Use a SUM aggregation on the Amount field. Group the rows by Close Month and the columns by Type. Save it in the Public Reports.
```

query_templated: Create a list view of records of the Opportunity object. The list is named as ByAmount. Include only Account Name and Amount field.  The list view should only be accessible to 'CFO' and 'Channel Sales Team'.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a list view of records of the [Opportunity] object. The list is named as [ByAmount]. Include only [Account Name] and [Amount] field. The list view should only be accsible to [CFO] and [Channel Sales Team].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the Opportunity list view “ByAmount” with only Account Name and Amount, shared to CFO and Channel Sales Team:

- Access Opportunities
  - Log in.
  - Open App Launcher, search “opportunities,” and open the Opportunities object.

- Create the list view
  - Open List View Controls > New.
  - Name the list “ByAmount.”
  - Set visibility to “Share list view with group of users.”
  - Choose Roles, search and add “CFO” and “Channel Sales Team.”
  - Save.

- Configure visible fields
  - Open List View Controls > Select Fields to Display.
  - Keep only Account Name and Amount by removing other default columns (removed: Opportunity Name, Stage, Close Date, Opportunity Owner Alias).
  - Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a list view of records of the [Case] object. The list is named as [AllCasesByPriority]. Include only [Case Number] and [Priority] fields. The list view should only be accessible to [Customer Support, International], [Project Lead], and [Customer Support, North America].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the AllCasesByPriority list view for Case:

1) Open Cases
- Log in.
- Open App Launcher, search for “cases”, and select “Cases”.

2) Create the list view
- Open List View Controls > New.
- Set List Name: AllCasesByPriority.
- In “Who sees this list view,” choose “Share list view with groups of users.”
- For sharing, choose Roles and add:
  - Customer Support, International
  - Project Lead
  - Customer Support, North America
- Save.

3) Configure visible fields
- Open List View Controls > Select Fields to Display.
- Remove all fields except Case Number and Priority (removed Contact Name, Subject, Status, Case Owner Alias).
- Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please create a new list view on the Opportunity object named ByAmount. Show only two columns—Account Name and Amount—and make it visible exclusively to the "CFO" and the "Channel Sales Team".
```

TASK:Create a list view of records of the [Case] object. The list is named as [AllCasesByPriority]. Include only [Case Number] and [Priority] fields. The list view should only be accessible to [Customer Support, International], [Project Lead], and [Customer Support, North America].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the AllCasesByPriority list view for Case:

1) Open Cases
- Log in.
- Open App Launcher, search for “cases”, and select “Cases”.

2) Create the list view
- Open List View Controls > New.
- Set List Name: AllCasesByPriority.
- In “Who sees this list view,” choose “Share list view with groups of users.”
- For sharing, choose Roles and add:
  - Customer Support, International
  - Project Lead
  - Customer Support, North America
- Save.

3) Configure visible fields
- Open List View Controls > Select Fields to Display.
- Remove all fields except Case Number and Priority (removed Contact Name, Subject, Status, Case Owner Alias).
- Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

query_templated: Create an app with name Energy Consultations. Choose Task, Contact objects from available items as the navigation items. For User Profiles, choose the System Administrator, Custom: Sales Profile from the available profiles. Leave the rest required fields as the default.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create an app with name Energy Consultations. Choose Task, Contact objects from available items as the navigation items. For User Profiles, choose the System Administrator, Custom: Sales Profile from the available profiles. Leave the rest required fields as the default.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the Lightning app:

- Log in and open Setup: Click Setup (gear) -> Setup. In Quick Find, type “App Manager” and open App Manager.
- Create the app: Click New Lightning App. Enter App Name: “Energy Consultations”. Leave other required fields at defaults (Developer Name auto-populates). Click Next through the intermediate setup pages until Navigation Items.
- Configure Navigation Items: In Available Items search, type “Task”, select “Tasks”, click Add. Then type “Contact”, select “Contacts”, click Add. Click Next.
- Assign User Profiles: In Available Profiles search, type “System Administrator”, select it, click Add. Then type “Custom: Sales Profile”, select it, click Add.
- Finish: Click Save & Finish.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create an app with name Customer Service. Choose Customers, Analytics objects from available items as the navigation items. For User Profiles, choose the Customer Portal Manager (Standard), Standard User, Custom: Support Profile from the available profiles. Leave the rest required fields as the default.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup (gear icon > Setup).
- In Quick Find, type “App Manager” and open App Manager.
- Click “New Lightning App.”
- App Details & Branding:
  - Set App Name to “Customer Service.”
  - Leave Developer Name as the auto-populated default.
  - Click Next.
- Proceed through the next configuration screens (App Options, Utility Items, etc.) keeping defaults and clicking Next until Navigation Items.
- Navigation Items:
  - In Available Items, search “Customers,” select it, and click Add.
  - Search “Analytics,” select it, and click Add.
  - Click Next.
- User Profiles:
  - In Available Profiles, search and add each of:
    - Customer Portal Manager (Standard)
    - Standard User
    - Custom: Support Profile
  - Click Save & Finish to create the app.

## Your ultimate task
```
Spin up a new app named Energy Consultations. Add Task and Contact to the navigation bar from the available items list. In User Profiles, select System Administrator, Custom: Sales Profile from the available profiles. Keep all other required fields at their default values.
```

query_templated: Create a custom tab for a custom object MyAnimal. Choose the Sun tab style. Make the tab visible  to only System Administrator profile and can only be accssed through the Sales App.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a custom tab for a custom object [MyAnimal]. Choose the [Sun] tab style. Make the tab visible to only [System Administrator] profile and can only be accssed through the [Sales] App.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Authenticate:
  - Click Log In, enter the verification code, and click Verify.

- Navigate to tab creation:
  - Go to Setup > Create > Tabs (Custom Tabs).
  - Start creating a new custom object tab.

- Configure tab:
  - Select the custom object: MyAnimal.
  - Open Tab Style picker and choose Sun.
  - Click Next.

- Set profile visibility:
  - Set “Tab Visibility for all profiles” to Default Off.
  - For the System Administrator profile, set Tab Visibility to Default On.
  - Click Next.

- Add to apps:
  - Use the “Select/Deselect All” checkbox to clear all apps.
  - Check only the Sales app.
  - Click Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a custom tab for a custom object MyBike. Choose the Books tab style. Make the tab visible to only External Apps User profile and can only be accssed through the Platform App.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Tabs” and open the Tabs page.
- Under Custom Object Tabs, click New.
- Set Object to “MyBike”.
- Click Tab Style and choose “Books”.
- Click Next.
- Profile visibility:
  - Set “Tab Hidden” for all profiles.
  - Change the “External Apps User” profile to “Default On”.
- Click Next.
- App selection:
  - Ensure only “Platform App” is checked (uncheck any “Select All” or other apps).
- Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Create a custom tab for the MyAnimal object, use the Sun tab style, restrict visibility to the System Administrator profile only, and make it available exclusively inside the Sales App.
```

query_templated: Create a matching rule named Contact with Fuzzy Logic on the Contact. Use Exact matching method for the Email field and leave its Match Blank Field box unchecked.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a matching rule named [Contact with Fuzzy Logic] on the [Contact object]. Use [Exact macthing] method for the [email field] and leave its Match Black Field box unchecked.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Go to Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Matching Rules” and open it.
- Click “New Rule.”
- Select Object: Contact, then click Next.
- Enter Rule Name: “Contact with Fuzzy Logic.”
- Add matching criteria:
  - Field: Email
  - Matching Method: Exact
  - Ensure “Match Blank Fields” is unchecked
- Click Save. If prompted for a unique name, set it to “FuzzyLogics” and Save again.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a matching rule named [Lead Phone Match] on the [Lead object]. Use the [Fuzzy matching] method for the [Phone field] and leave its Match Blank Field box unchecked. 
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Matching Rules” and open it.
- Click “New Rule.”
- Choose Object = Lead, then click Next.
- Enter Rule Name = “Lead Phone Match.”
- Define the matching criteria:
  - Field = Phone
  - Matching Method = Fuzzy
  - Ensure “Match Blank Field” remains unchecked (default).
- Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please set up a rule on the Contact object called "Contact with Fuzzy Logic." For the Email field, require an Exact match, and make sure the Match Blank Field option stays off.
```

query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a custom object named [WildBird]. Check "Launch New Custom Tab Wizard after saving this custom object" box and select "Tab Style: [Bridge]" and finish the remaining steps with the default values.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in and navigate to Setup → Object Manager.
- Create → Custom Object.
- Enter:
  - Label: WildBird
  - Plural Label: WildBirds
- Check the box “Launch New Custom Tab Wizard after saving this custom object.”
- Save.
- In the New Custom Tab Wizard:
  - Click Tab Style and select “Bridge.”
  - Click Next, keeping default settings.
  - Click Next again, keeping default settings.
  - Click Save to finish.

Notes:
- Scrolling may be needed to locate the checkbox and action buttons.
- No hot-keys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a custom object named [StormTracker]. Check "Launch New Custom Tab Wizard after saving this custom object," select Tab Style: [Lightning], and finish with default values.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Navigate to Setup > Create > Custom Object.
- Enter object details:
  - Label: StormTracker
  - Plural Label: StormTrackers
  - Ensure “Launch New Custom Tab Wizard after saving this custom object” is checked.
- Click Save to launch the New Custom Tab Wizard.
- In the Tab Style step, select “Lightning” and click Next.
- Proceed through the remaining wizard pages with default values by clicking Next as needed.
- Click Save to finish.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please build a new custom object labeled MyHouse. Make sure the “Launch New Custom Tab Wizard after saving this custom object” box is enabled so you can choose any tab style you like, and leave everything else at the default settings.
```

query_templated: Update the description of MyAnimal object with the text Updated Description. And update the help text of the Breed field to Updated Help text for breed.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Update the description of MyAnimal object with the text Updated Description. And update the help text of the Breed field to Updated Help text for breed.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Setup, use Quick Find to search for “Object Manager” and open it.
- In Object Manager, use Quick Find to search for “MyAnimal” and open the MyAnimal object.
- Click Edit for the MyAnimal object, update the Description field to: Updated Description, then Save.
- Go to Fields & Relationships, open the Breed field, click Edit, update the Help Text to: Updated Help text for breed, then Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Update the description of MyBike object with the text This is the name of the Bike. And update the help text of the Brand field to This is the brand name of the Bike.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup, use Quick Find to search for “Object Manager,” and open Object Manager.
- In Object Manager, search for “MyBike” and open the MyBike object.
- Update Brand field help text:
  - Go to Fields & Relationships.
  - Open the Brand field and click Edit.
  - Set Help Text to: “This is the brand name of the Bike.”
  - Save.
- Update object description:
  - Go to the Details tab of the MyBike object.
  - Click Edit.
  - Set Description to: “This is the name of the Bike.”
  - Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Could you hop into the MyAnimal object and change its description to "Updated Description"? Also, update the Breed field’s help text so it says "Updated Help text for breed".
```

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a custom object named Favorite. Then create a Lookup Relationship with Contact object. It should only be visible to System Administrator, Solution Manager profiles.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Navigate to Create > Custom Object.
  - Create a new custom object with:
    - Label: Favorite
    - Plural Label: Favorites
  - Save.
- Open the Favorite object, go to Fields & Relationships, and click New.
  - Choose data type: Lookup Relationship, then Next.
  - Related To: Contact, then Next.
  - Accept defaults for field name, then Next as needed.
  - Field-Level Security: ensure Visible is checked only for the System Administrator and Solution Manager profiles (uncheck all other profiles).
  - Continue through the remaining Next steps (page layout/related list) and Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a custom object named ToughToClose. Then create a Lookup Relationship with Opportunity object. It should only be visible to Customer Portal User, Standard User profiles.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create ToughToClose object and a lookup to Opportunity with restricted visibility:

1) Access Setup
- Log in.
- Click Setup.

2) Create the custom object
- Go to Create > Custom Object.
- Enter Label: ToughToClose; Plural Label: ToughToCloses.
- Click Save.

3) Add a Lookup Relationship to Opportunity
- In the ToughToClose object, open Fields & Relationships.
- Click New.
- Select Lookup Relationship and click Next.
- Set Related To = Opportunity and click Next.
- Accept defaults on subsequent step(s) and click Next.

4) Set field-level security (visibility)
- On the Field-Level Security step, clear default visibility if needed.
- Check Visible only for:
  - Customer Portal User
  - Standard User
- Click Next.

5) Finalize
- Accept defaults for page layout assignment (Next).
- Click Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
- Visibility was explicitly set only for Customer Portal User and Standard User profiles.

## Your ultimate task
```
Go ahead and create a custom object called Favorite, hook it to Contact object with a Lookup Relationship, and lock down access so only the System Administrator and Solution Manager profiles can see it.
```

query_templated: Create a Permission set by setting the label as Account Access. The license is set to None. Enable Account Object Permissions: Read, Create. Enable Read and Edit Access for all fields.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a Permission set by setting the label as Account Access. The license is set to None. Enable Account Object Permissions: Read, Create. Enable Read and Edit Access for all fields.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Permission Sets” and open it.
- Click New to create a permission set.
- Enter Label: “Account Access”. Click the API Name field to auto-populate it.
- Ensure License is set to None (leave the default None).
- Click Save.
- In the permission set, go to Object Settings > Accounts > Edit.
- Under Object Permissions, enable Read and Create.
- Under Field Permissions, enable Read Access for all fields and Edit Access for all fields (use the select-all checkboxes).
- Click Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a Permission set by setting the label as Opportunity Access. The license is set to None. Enable Opportunities Object Permissions: Read, Edit. Enable Read and Edit Access for all fields.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Permission Sets” and open it.
- Click New to create a permission set.
  - Set Label to “Opportunity Access”. Click the API Name field to auto-populate it.
  - Leave License set to None.
  - Save.
- In the created permission set, go to Object Settings.
  - Open Opportunities, click Edit.
  - Enable Object Permissions: check Read and Edit.
  - Enable field access: check “Read Access” and “Edit Access” for all fields.
  - Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please set up a new Permission Set named “Account Access.” Leave the license as None. On the Account object, grant object permissions for Read and Create. Also give Read and Edit access to all fields.
```

- In Quick Find, search for “Permission Sets” and open it.
- Click New to create a permission set.
  - Set Label to “Opportunity Access”. Click the API Name field to auto-populate it.
  - Leave License set to None.
  - Save.
- In the created permission set, go to Object Settings.
  - Open Opportunities, click Edit.
  - Enable Object Permissions: check Read and Edit.
  - Enable field access: check “Read Access” and “Edit Access” for all fields.
  - Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
I need a Permission Set with these specs: - Label: Opportunity Access - License: None - Opportunity Object Permissions: Read, Edit. Read and Edit for every field
```

query_templated: Create a Permission Set Group with the label name Product Admin. Include the Merchandiser access set.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a Permission Set Group with the label name Product Admin. Include the Merchandiser permission set.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type "Permission Set Groups" and select it.
- Click "New Permission Set Group".
- Enter Label: "Product Admin" and click "Save".
- In the "Permission Sets in Group" related list, click "Add Permission Set".
- Filter to M (if needed), check "Merchandiser".
- Click "Add", then "Done".
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a Permission Set Group with the label name Agentforce Data Admin1. Include the Data Cloud Admin access set.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the Permission Set Group and include Data Cloud Admin:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Permission Set Groups” and open it.
- Click “New Permission Set Group.”
- Enter the label: “Agentforce Data Admin1” and Save.
- Open the “Permission Sets in Group” section and click “Add Permission Set.”
- Use the index filter for the letter “D,” select the checkbox for “Data Cloud Admin,” click “Add,” then “Done.”

## Your ultimate task
```
Create a Permission Set Group, give it the label Product Admin, and add the Merchandiser access set to it.
```

query_templated: Assign the MarketingAnalyticsUser permission set group to user Foo Bar.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Assign the [MarketAnalyticsUser] permission set group to the user [Foo Bar].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to assign the MarketingAnalyticsUser permission set group to user Foo Bar:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “permission set group” and open Permission Set Groups.
- Select the “MarketingAnalyticsUser” permission set group.
- Click Manage Assignments, then Add Assignments.
- Select the user “Foo Bar” (open the user record).
- In the user record, open Permission Set Group Assignments, click Edit Assignments.
- Select “MarketingAnalyticsUser” from Available groups (scroll if needed), click Add.
- Click Save, then Continue if prompted.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Assign the [Manufacturing Admin] permission set group to the user [Sample user].

EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to assign the Manufacturing Admin permission set group to Sample User:

1. Log in and open Setup.
2. In Quick Find, type “permission set group” and open Permission Set Groups.
3. Open the “Manufacturing Admin” permission set group.
4. Click Manage Assignments > Add Assignment.
5. Select “Sample User” to open the user record.
6. In the user’s Permission Set Group Assignments related list, click Edit Assignments.
7. Move “Manufacturing Admin” from Available to Enabled (click Add).
8. Click Save and confirm (Continue if prompted).

## Your ultimate task
```
Could you go ahead and grant Foo Bar the MarketingAnalyticsUser permission set group?
```

query_templated: Configure the organization-wide defaults for the MyAnimal__c object with visibility Private for internal users, visibility Private for external users, and allow users higher in the role hierarchy.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Configure the organization-wide defaults for the MyAnimal__c object with visibility Private for internal users, visibility Private for external users, and allow users higher in the role hierarchy.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to configure OWD for MyAnimal__c:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Sharing Settings” and open Sharing Settings.
- Click Edit in the Organization-Wide Defaults section.
- Scroll to the MyAnimal__c row.
- Set Default Internal Access to Private.
- Set Default External Access to Private.
- Check Grant Access Using Hierarchies (to allow users higher in the role hierarchy).
- Click Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Configure the organization-wide defaults for the MyBike__c object with visibility Public Read Only for internal users, visibility Private for external users, and allow users higher in the role hierarchy.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup (gear icon > Setup).
- In Quick Find, enter “Sharing Settings” and open it.
- Click Edit under Organization-Wide Defaults.
- Scroll to/find the MyBike__c object row.
- Set Default Internal Access to Public Read Only.
- Set Default External Access to Private.
- Check Grant Access Using Hierarchies (to allow users higher in the role hierarchy).
- Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
For MyAnimal__c, tighten sharing: set the organization-wide defaults to Private for internal users and Private for external users, and make sure Grant Access Using Hierarchies is turned on.
```

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Configure the organization-wide defaults for the MyAnimal__c object with visibility Private for internal users, visibility Private for external users, and allow users higher in the role hierarchy.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to configure OWD for MyAnimal__c:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Sharing Settings” and open Sharing Settings.
- Click Edit in the Organization-Wide Defaults section.
- Scroll to the MyAnimal__c row.
- Set Default Internal Access to Private.
- Set Default External Access to Private.
- Check Grant Access Using Hierarchies (to allow users higher in the role hierarchy).
- Click Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Configure the organization-wide defaults for the MyBike__c object with visibility Public Read Only for internal users, visibility Private for external users, and allow users higher in the role hierarchy.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup (gear icon > Setup).
- In Quick Find, enter “Sharing Settings” and open it.
- Click Edit under Organization-Wide Defaults.
- Scroll to/find the MyBike__c object row.
- Set Default Internal Access to Public Read Only.
- Set Default External Access to Private.
- Check Grant Access Using Hierarchies (to allow users higher in the role hierarchy).
- Click Save.

query_templated: Freeze a user with Username Alice Bob
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Freeze a user with Username Alice Bob
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:
- Log in to the system by clicking Log In.
- Use the Global Search Bar: click it and type "alice bob".
- From results, select "Alice Bob — User".
- Open the User Detail page.
- Click Freeze to freeze the user.
Sample 2:
TASK:Freeze a user with Username Foo Bar
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to freeze user "Foo Bar":

1. Log in by clicking the Log In button.
2. Use the Global Search Bar to search for "foo bar".
3. From the results, click the "Foo Bar" User entry.
4. Open the User Detail page.
5. Click the Freeze action to freeze the user.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please freeze the account for the Username "Alice Bob" right away.
```

query_templated: Deactivate a user with Username Sample User
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Deactivate a user with Username Sample User
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to deactivate user "Sample User":

- Log in to the application (if prompted).
- Open Setup (gear icon > Setup).
- In Quick Find, type "Users" and select Users.
- Locate and open the user record for "Sample User," then click Edit.
- Uncheck the “Active” checkbox to deactivate the user.
- Confirm the deactivation in the prompt (click OK).
- Click Save to apply the change.
Sample 2:
TASK:Deactivate a user with Username John Doe
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to deactivate user "John Doe":

1) Log in to the application.
2) Open Setup.
3) In Quick Find, type “Users” and select the Users page.
4) Locate user “John Doe” and click Edit.
5) Toggle off the “Active” checkbox.
6) Confirm the deactivation when prompted (OK).
7) Click Save to apply changes.

Notes:
- Input used: typed “Users” into Quick Find.
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please disable the account for the user whose username is "Sample User"
```

query_templated: Create a new permission set group AgentforceReadOnlyAccess and add permissions Read-Only, Analytics View Access to this group, assign this permission set group to user John Doe.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a new permission set group named "AgentforceReadOnlyAccess". Add the permission sets ["Read-Only", "Analytics View Access"] to the group. Then assign this permission set group to the user "John Doe".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Setup’s Quick Find, search for “Permission Set Groups” and open it.
- Create the group:
  - Click New Permission Set Group.
  - Enter Label: AgentforceReadOnlyAccess.
  - Save.
- Add permission sets to the group:
  - Click Permission Sets in Group > Add Permission Set.
  - Use the alphabetical index “A” to jump to A; select Analytics View Access; click Add, then Done.
  - Click Add Permission Set again.
  - Use the alphabetical index “R” to jump to R; check Read-Only; click Add, then Done.
- Assign the group to the user John Doe:
  - Back to the Permission Set Group > Manage Assignments > Add Assignment.
  - Select John Doe and open Permission Set Group Assignments.
  - Click Edit Assignments, select AgentforceReadOnlyAccess, click Add, then Save.

Notes:
- The alphabetical index (“A”, “R”) was used to quickly navigate the permission set list.
- No keyboard hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a new permission set group named "MarketingInsightsUserGroup". Add the permission sets ["Marketing Manager", "Dashboard Viewer"] to the group. Assign this permission set group to the user "Sample User".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

1) Access Permission Set Groups
- Log in, open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “permission set group” and open “Permission Set Groups”.

2) Create the group
- Click “New Permission Set Group”.
- Enter Label: “MarketingInsightsUserGroup”.
- Save.

3) Add required permission sets to the group
- Open “Permission Sets in Group” > “Add Permission Set”.
- Use the letter index “M”, select “Marketing Manager”, click “Add”, then “Done”.
- Click “Add Permission Set” again.
- Use the letter index “D”, select “Dashboard Viewer”, click “Add”, then “Done”.

4) Assign the group to the user “Sample User”
- Go back to the Permission Set Group detail page.
- Click “Manage Assignments” > “Add Assignment”.
- Select “Sample User” to open the user record.
- In the user record, open “Permission Set Group Assignments” > “Edit Assignments”.
- Select “MarketingInsightsUserGroup”, click “Add”, then “Save”.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used; navigation was via clicks, typing in Quick Find, and list letter indexes (“M” and “D”).

## Your ultimate task
```

memory:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a new permission set group named "AgentforceReadOnlyAccess". Add the permission sets ["Read-Only", "Analytics View Access"] to the group. Then assign this permission set group to the user "John Doe".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Setup’s Quick Find, search for “Permission Set Groups” and open it.
- Create the group:
  - Click New Permission Set Group.
  - Enter Label: AgentforceReadOnlyAccess.
  - Save.
- Add permission sets to the group:
  - Click Permission Sets in Group > Add Permission Set.
  - Use the alphabetical index “A” to jump to A; select Analytics View Access; click Add, then Done.
  - Click Add Permission Set again.
  - Use the alphabetical index “R” to jump to R; check Read-Only; click Add, then Done.
- Assign the group to the user John Doe:
  - Back to the Permission Set Group > Manage Assignments > Add Assignment.
  - Select John Doe and open Permission Set Group Assignments.
  - Click Edit Assignments, select AgentforceReadOnlyAccess, click Add, then Save.

Notes:
- The alphabetical index (“A”, “R”) was used to quickly navigate the permission set list.
- No keyboard hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a new permission set group named "MarketingInsightsUserGroup". Add the permission sets ["Marketing Manager", "Dashboard Viewer"] to the group. Assign this permission set group to the user "Sample User".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

1) Access Permission Set Groups
- Log in, open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “permission set group” and open “Permission Set Groups”.

2) Create the group
- Click “New Permission Set Group”.
- Enter Label: “MarketingInsightsUserGroup”.
- Save.

3) Add required permission sets to the group
- Open “Permission Sets in Group” > “Add Permission Set”.
- Use the letter index “M”, select “Marketing Manager”, click “Add”, then “Done”.
- Click “Add Permission Set” again.
- Use the letter index “D”, select “Dashboard Viewer”, click “Add”, then “Done”.

4) Assign the group to the user “Sample User”
- Go back to the Permission Set Group detail page.
- Click “Manage Assignments” > “Add Assignment”.
- Select “Sample User” to open the user record.
- In the user record, open “Permission Set Group Assignments” > “Edit Assignments”.
- Select “MarketingInsightsUserGroup”, click “Add”, then “Save”.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used; navigation was via clicks, typing in Quick Find, and list letter indexes (“M” and “D”).

query_templated: Add a formula field with the name Days to close to the object Opportunity. It tracks the number of days until an Opportunity Closes. This newly added field should only be visible to Marketing User profiles.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Add a formula field with the name [Days to close] to the object [Opportunity]. [It tracks the number of days until an Opportunity Closes]. This newly added field should only be visible to [Marketing User].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to add the “Days to close” formula field on Opportunity and restrict visibility to Marketing User:

- Navigate to Setup > Object Manager > Opportunity > Fields & Relationships.
- Click New, select Formula, and click Next.
- Set Field Label: Days to close; choose Return Type: Number; continue.
- Build the formula:
  - Insert Field: Close Date
  - Operator: Subtract (-)
  - Function: TODAY()
  - Final formula: CloseDate - TODAY()
- Proceed to Field-Level Security:
  - Deselect global visibility (uncheck “Visible to all”).
  - Select only the Marketing User profile for visibility.
- Click Next, then Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Add a formula field with the name [Check country] to the object [Account] [It checks if the billing country of the account is the same as the account owner's country]. This newly added field should only be visible to [Marketing User, Analytics Cloud Security User, and Einstein Agent User].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Navigate: Setup > Object Manager > Account > Fields & Relationships > New.
- Choose field type: Formula. Set Return Type: Checkbox. Click Next.
- Set Field Label: Check country (API Name auto-populates). Click Next.
- Build the formula:
  - Insert Field: Billing Country.
  - Insert Operator: = (Equal).
  - Insert Field: Account Owner > Country.
  - This yields a boolean formula equivalent to: BillingCountry = Owner.Country.
  - Click Next.
- Set Field-Level Security:
  - Deselect the “Visible” header checkbox to clear visibility for all profiles.
  - Check visibility only for:
    - Marketing User
    - Analytics Cloud Security User
    - Einstein Agent User
  - Click Next.
- Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
On the Opportunity object, please add a formula field named “Days to close” that shows how many days are left until the Close Date. Lock down field visibility so only the Marketing User profile can see it.
```

query_templated: Create a validation rule for the Account Object. This rule checks if the Account Number field's characters length is not 8. If the rule is triggered, the error message should be account number must be 8 characters long..
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a validation rule for the [Account] Object. [This rule checks if the Account Number field's characters length is not 8]. If the rule is triggered, the error message should be [account number must be 8 characters long.] 
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the validation rule on Account:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Use Quick Find to search for and open Object Manager.
- Open the Account object.
- Go to Validation Rules and click New.
- Set Rule Name: AccountNumber_Length_Check.
- Set Error Condition Formula: LEN(AccountNumber) <> 8
- Set Error Message: account number must be 8 characters long.
- Click Check Syntax, then Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a validation rule for the Contact object. This rule should check if the Email field does not contain "@company.com". If the email address is from a different domain, the error message should be: "Email must be a company email ending in '@company.com'.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup (gear icon > Setup).
- In Setup, navigate: Objects and Fields > Object Manager.
- Use Quick Find to search for “Contact” and open the Contact object.
- Go to Validation Rules and click New.
- Set Rule Name: Enforce_Company_Email_Domain.
- Set Error Condition Formula: NOT(CONTAINS(Email, "@company.com"))
- Set Error Message: Email must be a company email ending in '@company.com'.
- Click Check Syntax, then Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
On the Account object, add a validaiton rule: if the Account Number isn’t exactly 8 characters long, block the save and show this message: "account number must be 8 characters long.".
```

ground_truth_dict.error_message: account number must be 8 characters long.

query_templated: Reorder the picklist values of Campaign Object's Status field. by moving the value "Aborted" to the top and make it the default value
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:[Reorder the picklist values of] the [Campaign]'s [Status] field [by moving the value "Aborted" to the top and make it the default value].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to reorder Campaign Status picklist and set default to Aborted:

- Log in and open Setup.
- Navigate to Object Manager.
- Use Quick Find to locate and open the Campaign object.
- Go to Fields & Relationships, search for and open the Status field.
- Click Reorder, select “Aborted,” use “Move to Top,” then Save.
- Click Edit on the picklist values screen, check the option to make “Aborted” the default, then Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a new picklist value "Pending" in the Case object's Status field.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create a new picklist value "Pending" in Case Status:

1. Log in to Salesforce.
2. Open Setup (gear icon > Setup).
3. In Setup, navigate to Objects and Fields > Object Manager.
4. Open the Case object.
5. Go to Fields & Relationships.
6. Select the Status field.
7. Click New Picklist Value.
8. Enter Pending as the value.
9. Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
In the Campaign object, move the Status picklist so that "Aborted" sits at the very top and make it the default selection for new Campaigns.
```

query_templated: Create a global value set with the name Ingredients and it should have sugar, butter, milk as the pick list values. Sort the values alphabetically.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a global value set with the name [Ingredients] and it should have [sugar, butter, and milk] as the pick list values. Sort the values alphabetically.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the global value set "Ingredients" with alphabetically sorted values:

- Log in to Salesforce and go to Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “picklist” and select “Picklist Value Sets.”
- Click “New” to create a new global value set.
- Enter Label: “Ingredients” (API Name will auto-populate when focusing the Name field).
- In the Values area, add each value on its own line:
  - sugar
  - butter
  - milk
- Enable the option to display/sort values alphabetically.
- Click Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.
- The alphabetical sort ensures the picklist values appear as: butter, milk, sugar.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a global value set with the name [annotators] and it should have [michael, fabri, and caitlyn] as the pick list values. Set the description to [annotators for the webagent task]. Sort the values alphabetically.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the global picklist value set:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In the Setup Quick Find box, search for “picklist” and select “Picklist Value Sets” (Global Value Sets).
- Click “New” to create a new value set.
- Set Label to “annotators” (API Name will auto-populate).
- In the Values box, enter each on a new line:
  - michael
  - fabri
  - caitlyn
- Set Description to “annotators for the webagent task”.
- Enable “Sort values alphabetically”.
- Click “Save”.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please add a global value set called Ingredients and include these picklist options: sugar, butter, and milk. Make sure the values are displayed A–Z.
```

query_templated: Update the org's password policies as follows: update the password expire days to 180 days and set lockout effective period to forever.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Update the org's password polices as follows: update the [password expire days] to [180 days] and [set lockout effective period to forever].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to update password policies:

1. Log in to the org.
2. Open Setup.
3. In the Quick Find search box, type “password policies”.
4. Select “Password Policies” from the results.
5. Set “User passwords expire in” to “180 days”.
6. Set “Lockout effective period” to “Forever”.
7. Click “Save” to apply changes.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:"Update the org's password polices as follows: update the [Password complexity requirements] to [Must include numbers and uppercase and lowercase letters], and [Maximum invalid login attempts] to [5]."
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to the org.
- Open Setup.
- Use Quick Find to search for “Password Policies” and select it.
- In Password Policies:
  - Set Password complexity requirements to “Must include numbers and uppercase and lowercase letters.”
  - Set Maximum invalid login attempts to 5.
- Save the changes.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please tune the org-wide password settings so that passwords expire every 180 days, and make lockouts permanent.
```

query_templated: Create a CTO role which shoule be in the same level as the CEO. Under the CTO, create a new role called VP in R&D..
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:[Create a CTO role which shoule be in the same level as the CEO. Under the CTO, create a new role called VP in R&D].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “roles” and open Roles > Set Up Roles.
- Create CTO as a top-level role (peer to CEO):
  - Click Add Role.
  - Enter Label: CTO (let Role Name auto-populate).
  - Save.
- Create VP in R&D under CTO:
  - Return to Roles > Set Up Roles.
  - Select the CTO node and click Add Role (to create a child role under CTO).
  - Enter Label: VP in R&D (let Role Name auto-populate).
  - Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
- The key placement actions are: add CTO at the top level (same level as CEO), then add VP in R&D as a child of CTO.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a [Customer Support, New York] role which should be under the [Customer Support, North America] role. Under the [Customer Support, New York] role, create a new role called [Customer Service Agent].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce, open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “users,” then navigate to Users > Roles > Set Up Roles.
- Expand the role hierarchy and use Add Role (from the appropriate parent context) to create a child role:
  - Enter Label: “Customer Support, New York” (Role Name auto-populates after focusing the Role Name field).
  - Click Save & New.
- Create the next role under the newly created role:
  - Enter Label: “Customer Service Agent” (focus Role Name field to auto-populate).
  - Set parent via Lookup on “This role reports to” and select “Customer Support, New York.”
  - Click Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
- “Save & New” was used to chain creation of the second role immediately after the first.

## Your ultimate task
```
Add a new CTO role to be a peer of the CEO (same level on the role hierarchy chart). Under the CTO, add a role titled "VP in R&D".
```
human_review_comment: tweak a bit to avoid ambiguity

query_templated: Build an approval process for the records in the Opportunity Object using the Jump Start Wizard. Name this process as Approve Opportunity Amount. The entry criteria is set to the opportunity amount is greater than 200.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Build an approval process for the records in the [Opportunity] Object using the Jump Start Wizard. Name this process as [Approve Opportunity Amount]. The entry criteria is set to [the opportunity amount is greater than 200].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to build the approval process:

- Log in and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Approval Processes” and open it.
- Set “Manage Approval Processes For” to Opportunity.
- Click “Create New Approval Process” and choose “Use Jump Start Wizard.”
- Enter Process Name: “Approve Opportunity Amount.”
- Click into the Unique Name field to auto-populate it.
- Define entry criteria:
  - Field: Opportunity: Amount
  - Operator: greater than
  - Value: 200
- Click Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Build an approval process for the records in the [Account] Object using the Jump Start Wizard. Name this process as [Approve Low Earning Account]. The entry criteria is set to [Account: Billing Country not equal to United States] and [Account: Annual Revenue is less than 100000].
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to build the approval process:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Approval Processes” and navigate to it.
- In “Manage Approval Processes For,” select Account.
- Click “Create New Approval Process” and choose “Use Jump Start Wizard.”
- Set Process Name to “Approve Low Earning Account.” (Leave Unique Name auto-populated.)
- Define entry criteria with two conditions:
  - Field: Account: Billing Country | Operator: not equal to | Value: United States
  - Field: Account: Annual Revenue | Operator: less than | Value: 100000
- Click Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please set up an approval process on the Opportunity object using the Jump Start Wizard. Name it "Approve Opportunity Amount" and have it fire only when the Opportunity Amount is greater than 200.
```

query_template_metadata.template_string: Build an approval process for the records in the {object_name} Object using the Jump Start Wizard. Name this process as {approval_process_name}. The entry criteria is set to {entry_criteria_formula}.

instance_dict.entry_criteria_formula: the opportunity amount is greater than 200

- Click Save.

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Configure the required_account_action approval process's final approval actions by adding a new action with the name "mark_clean", which sets the "Clean Status" field value to "In Sync". Similarly, add a new action under the final rejection actions with the name "mark_inactive", which sets the "Clean Status" field value to "Inactive".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to configure final approval/rejection actions for required_account_action:

1) Access the approval process
- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Setup.
- Navigate: Process Automation > Approval Processes.
- In “Manage Approval Processes For” dropdown, select Account.
- Open the approval process named required_account_action.

2) Add final approval field update
- Click “Add New Final Approval Actions” > Field Update.
- Name: mark_clean.
- Field to Update: Clean Status.
- New Field Value: In Sync (select a specific value).
- Save.

3) Add final rejection field update
- Click “Add New Final Rejection Action” > Field Update.
- Name: mark_inactive.
- Field to Update: Clean Status.
- New Field Value: Inactive (select a specific value).
- Save.

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:Configure the "required_product_action" approval process's final approval actions by adding a new action with the name "Activate", which sets the "Active" field value to "True". Similarly, add a new action under the "final rejection actions" with the name "Deserialize", which sets the Active field value to "False".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Navigate to Process Automation > Approval Processes.
- In the Manage… dropdown, select Product and open the approval process “required_product_action”.

Configure final approval action:
- Click Add New Final Approval Action > Field Update.
- Set Name: Activate.
- Set Field to Update: Active.
- Set value to True.
- Save.

Configure final rejection action:
- Click Add New Final Rejection Action > Field Update.
- Set Name: Deserialize.
- Set Field to Update: Active.
- Set value to False.
- Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
In the required_account_action approval process, adding new actions like this: under Final Approval Actions, add a field update named mark_clean that sets the Clean Status field to In Sync. Under Final Rejection Actions, add another field update named mark_inactive that sets Clean Status to Inactive.
```

- Name: mark_clean.
- Field to Update: Clean Status.
- New Field Value: In Sync (select a specific value).
- Save.

3) Add final rejection field update

- Name: mark_inactive.

- New Field Value: Inactive (select a specific value).
- Save.

TASK:Configure the "required_product_action" approval process's final approval actions by adding a new action with the name "Activate", which sets the "Active" field value to "True". Similarly, add a new action under the "final rejection actions" with the name "Deserialize", which sets the Active field value to "False".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Navigate to Process Automation > Approval Processes.
- In the Manage… dropdown, select Product and open the approval process “required_product_action”.

Configure final approval action:
- Click Add New Final Approval Action > Field Update.
- Set Name: Activate.
- Set Field to Update: Active.
- Set value to True.
- Save.

Configure final rejection action:
- Click Add New Final Rejection Action > Field Update.
- Set Name: Deserialize.
- Set Field to Update: Active.
- Set value to False.
- Save.

query_templated: The company LyLyApple opens two new sites in Asia (LyLyPear) and Europe (LyLyCherry).. Create an account with the name LyLyApple – HQ and two subordinate accounts: LyLyPear – Asia and LyLyCherry – Europe..
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:The company LyLyApple opens two new sites in Asia (LyLyPear) and Europe (LyLyCherry). Create an account with the name LyLyApple – HQ and two subordinate accounts: LyLyPear – Asia and LyLyCherry – Europe.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to the application.
- Navigate to Accounts and click New.
- Create the parent account:
  - Enter Account Name: “LyLyApple - HQ”.
  - Click Save & New to proceed to creating another account.
- Create the first child account:
  - Enter Account Name: “LyLyPear - Asia”.
  - Set Parent Account by searching/selecting “LyLyApple - HQ”.
  - Click Save & New.
- Create the second child account:
  - Enter Account Name: “LyLyCherry - Europe”.
  - Set Parent Account to “LyLyApple - HQ”.
  - Click Save.
- Verify hierarchy:
  - Go to Accounts, open “LyLyApple - HQ”, and select View Account Hierarchy.
Sample 2:
TASK:Both NovaAxis Corp and TerraLink Systems have recently expanded their global footprint. NovaAxis has launched a new division in South Korea (NovaAxis Seoul), while TerraLink has opened a new site in Kenya (TerraLink Nairobi)]. [Create two separate parent accounts: NovaAxis Corp – Global and TerraLink Systems – HQ], and [add one subordinate account under each: NovaAxis Seoul – South Korea and TerraLink Nairobi – Kenya
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to the app.
- Navigate to Accounts and click New.
- Create parent account 1:
  - Enter Account Name: "NovaAxis Corp - Global".
  - Click "Save & New".
- Create child account under parent 1:
  - Enter Account Name: "NovaAxis Seoul - South Korea".
  - Open the Parent Account lookup/search and select "NovaAxis Corp - Global".
  - Click "Save & New".
- Create parent account 2:
  - Enter Account Name: "TerraLink Systems - HQ".
  - Click "Save & New".
- Create child account under parent 2:
  - Enter Account Name: "TerraLink Nairobi - Kenya".
  - Open the Parent Account lookup/search and select "TerraLink Systems - HQ".
  - Click "Save".

Optional verification:
- Open Accounts, select each parent ("NovaAxis Corp - Global" and "TerraLink Systems - HQ"), and use "View Account Hierarchy" to confirm the child relationships.

Notes:
- Used the "Save & New" button to streamline consecutive record creation.
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
The company LyLyApple opens two new sites in Asia (LyLyPear) and Europe (LyLyCherry). Create an account with the name LyLyApple – HQ and two subordinate accounts: LyLyPear – Asia and LyLyCherry – Europe.

- Log in to the CRM.
- Navigate to Leads and click New to create a lead.
- Enter fields:
  - First Name: John
  - Last Name: Doe
  - Company: sForce
- Set picklists:
  - Lead Source: Web
  - Rating: Warm
  - Industry: Technology (scroll within the dropdown to locate and select Technology)
- Click Save to create the lead.

  - Company: GenePoint

  - Rating: Hot

query_templated: Convert the lead with name Frank Knight to 'Closed - Converted'. If the lead's company matches an existing account, select that account; otherwise create a new account with the lead's company name. Create a new opportunity with name Knight LLC Opportunity.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Convert the lead with name Frank Knight to 'Closed - Converted'. If the lead's company matches an existing account, select that account; otherwise create a new account with the lead's company name. Create a new opportunity with name Knight LLC Opportunity
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open App Launcher, search for “Leads”, and open the Leads app/list.
- Open the lead “Frank Knight.”
- Start conversion:
  - Set Lead Status to “Closed - Converted.”
  - Choose “Existing Account,” search for and select “Knight LLC.”
  - Enter Opportunity Name: “Knight LLC Opportunity.”
- Click Convert to complete.
Sample 2:
TASK:2. Convert the lead with name Jane Smith to 'Closed - Converted'. If the lead's company matches an existing account, select that account; otherwise create a new account with the lead's company name. Create a new opportunity with name Tech Giants Opportunity.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to convert the lead and create an opportunity:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Navigate to Leads > Recently Viewed and open the lead “Jane Smith.”
- Start the lead conversion:
  - Open the Convert action/modal.
  - Set Lead Status to “Converted.”
- Handle account selection:
  - Use Account Search and select the existing account “Tech Giants” (matching the lead’s company).
- Create the opportunity:
  - In Opportunity Name, enter “Tech Giants Opportunity.”
- Finalize by clicking Convert.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please convert Frank Knight’s lead and mark it as 'Closed - Converted'. If his company already exists as an Account, link the conversion to that Account; if it doesn’t, create a new Account using the lead’s company name. Then create a new Opportunity named Knight LLC Opportunity.
```

query_templated: Our company R&D department announced a new Product Family for "Running Shoes". For this release, we have two products. The first product "ChillRun" with the product code "CHILL-001" is the "best fit for lightweight exercise"; and the second product "MonsterRun" with the product code "MONS-001" is "designed for Marathon fans". Help me to create the relevant info in the Product records.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Our company R&D department announced a new Product Family for "Running Shoes". For this release, we have two products. The first product "ChillRun" with the product code "CHILL-001" is the "best fit for lightweight exercise"; and the second product "MonsterRun" with the product code "MONS-001" is "designed for Marathon fans". Help me to create the relevant info in the Product records.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

1) Add new Product Family value
- Navigate: Setup > Object Manager > Product > Fields & Relationships > Product Family.
- Click New and add picklist value: Running Shoes.
- Save.

2) Create product: ChillRun
- Go to App Launcher > View All > Products.
- Click New.
- Set fields:
  - Product Name: ChillRun
  - Active: checked
  - Product Code: CHILL-001
  - Product Family: Running Shoes
  - Description: Best fit for lightweight exercise
- Click Save & New.

3) Create product: MonsterRun
- In the new product form, set:
  - Product Name: MonsterRun
  - Active: checked
  - Product Code: MONS-001
  - Product Family: Running Shoes
  - Description: Designed for Marathon fans
- Click Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:TechNova has introduced a new Product Family focused on "Smart Home Lighting Solutions". For this release, we have three products. The first product "BrightEase" with the product code "BrightEase" is a "budget-friendly smart bulb for everyday use"; the second product "GlowSync" with the product code "Glowsync" "features customizable color schemes and app control"; and the third product "LuxEdge" with the product code "LuxEdge" is "designed for premium interiors with motion sensing and voice assistant integration". Help me to create the relevant info in the Product records.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the Product Family and Products in Salesforce:

1) Log in and add new Product Family picklist value
- Go to Setup > Object Manager > Product > Fields & Relationships > Product Family.
- Click New and add the picklist value: Smart Home Lighting Solutions.
- Save.

2) Create the three Product records
- Open App Launcher, search for and open Products.

- Product 1 (use Save & New):
  - New Product.
  - Product Name: BrightEase
  - Active: checked
  - Product Code: BrightEase
  - Product Family: Smart Home Lighting Solutions
  - Description: Budget-friendly smart bulb for everyday use.
  - Save & New.

- Product 2 (use Save & New):
  - Product Name: GlowSync
  - Active: checked
  - Product Code: GlowSync
  - Product Family: Smart Home Lighting Solutions
  - Description: Features customizable color schemes and app control.
  - Save & New.

- Product 3 (final Save):
  - Product Name: LuxEdge
  - Active: checked
  - Product Code: LuxEdge
  - Product Family: Smart Home Lighting Solutions
  - Description: Designed for premium interiors with motion sensing and voice assistant integration.
  - Save.

## Your ultimate task
```
Our company R&D department announced a new Product Family for "Running Shoes". For this release, we have two products. The first product "ChillRun" with the product code "CHILL-001" is the "best fit for lightweight exercise"; and the second product "MonsterRun" with the product code "MONS-001" is "designed for Marathon fans". Help me to create the relevant info in the Product records.
```

query_templated: Create price books with the following details: Set up two price books for the product "ThermalMax Pro": one called "Holiday Sale" with a unit price of $150, and another called "Year End Special" with a unit price of $140.. Each price book should include the specified products with their respective unit prices.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create price books with the following details: Set up two price books for the product "ThermalMax Pro": one called "Holiday Sale" with a unit price of $150, and another called "Year End Special" with a unit price of $140. Each price book should include the specified products with their respective unit prices.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open Price Books:
  - Click App Launcher > View All.
  - Search for “Price Books” and open it.
- Create “Holiday Sale” price book:
  - Click New Price Book, set Name = “Holiday Sale”, check Active, Save.
  - Add product and price:
    - Go to Related tab > Add Products.
    - Select “ThermalMax Pro” > Next.
    - Clear the List Price field (press Backspace to remove the default value), enter 150, Save.
- Create “Year End Special” price book:
  - Return to Price Books list, click New Price Book, set Name = “Year End Special”, check Active, Save.
  - Add product and price:
    - Go to Related tab > Add Products.
    - Select “ThermalMax Pro” > Next.
    - Clear the List Price field (press Backspace to remove the default value), enter 140, Save.

Notes on hot-keys:
- Used Backspace to clear the List Price field before entering the new unit prices.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create price books with the following details: Set up two price books for the product "CoolBreeze Elite": one called "Summer Special" with a unit price of $120, and another called "Winter Deal" with a unit price of $110. Each price book should include the specified products with their respective unit prices.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Price Books:
  - App Launcher > View All > search “Price Books” > open.

- Create “Summer Special” price book:
  - Click New, set Name = “Summer Special”, mark Active, Save.
  - On the price book record: Related > Add Products.
  - Select product “CoolBreeze Elite” > Next.

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:The client shows a great interest in the product ThermalMax Pro. Create a quote with the name Holiday Sale for the opportunity Product Development which expires 10 days from today. Let's apply 10% discount on the list price to make it the final Sales price. To qualify this price, the quantity needs to be 10.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open App Launcher, search for “Opportunities,” and open it.
- Open the “Product Development” opportunity.
- In the Quotes related list, click “New Quote.”
- Set:
  - Quote Name: “Holiday Sale”
  - Expiration Date: Today + 10 days
  - Save the quote.
- Open the newly created “Holiday Sale” quote.
- Click “Add Products.”
  - If prompted, confirm/save the price book.
  - Select the product “ThermalMax Pro” and click “Next.”
- In the line editor:
  - Set Quantity to 10.
  - Set Discount (Percentage) to 10.
  - Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.
- The 10% discount is applied to the list price to determine the final sales price.
Sample 2:
TASK:The client shows a great interest in the product CoolBreeze Elite. Create a quote with the name Summer Special for the opportunity Maintenance Contract which expires 1 week from today. Let's apply 3.5% discount on the list price to make it the final Sales price. To qualify this price, the quantity needs to be 14.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to the CRM and open Opportunities.
- Open the “Maintenance Contract” opportunity.
- In the Quotes related list, click New Quote.
- Set Quote Name to “Summer Special” and set Expiration Date to one week from today; Save.
- Open the newly created “Summer Special” quote.
- Click Add Products, select “CoolBreeze Elite,” then click Next.
- Edit the quote line:
  - Set Quantity to 14.
  - Set Discount (Percentage) to 3.5 to derive the final Sales price from the list price.
- Save the quote.

## Your ultimate task
```
The prospect is really into ThermalMax Pro—please spin up a quote titled "Holiday Sale" on the "Product Development" opportunity. Set it to expire 10 days from today. Make the final sales price equal to list price minus 10%, and only honor that pricing when the quantity is 10.
```

query_templated: Prepare a contract for the account Knight LLC. The start date is today. The contract term is 12 months. Then create an order based on this contract. The order start date should be the Friday following the contract start date.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Prepare a contract for the account Knight LLC. The start date is the third Friday of August, 2025. The contract term is 12 months. Then create an order based on this contract. The order start date should be the Friday following the contract start date.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

1) Access Contracts
- Log in.
- Open App Launcher > View All > search “contracts” > open Contracts.

2) Create the contract for Knight LLC
- Click New.
- In the Account lookup, select Knight LLC.
- Set Start Date to 8/15/2025 (third Friday of August 2025).
- Set Contract Term to 12 months.
- Save.

3) Create the order based on the contract
- Open App Launcher > View All > search “orders” > open Orders.
- Click New Order.
- In the Account lookup, select Knight LLC.
- Set Order Start Date to 8/22/2025 (the Friday following the contract start date).
- In the Contract lookup, select the Knight LLC contract created above.
- Save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used; navigation was done via App Launcher search and lookups.
- Dates entered: Contract 8/15/2025; Order 8/22/2025.
Sample 2:
TASK:Prepare a contract for the account Lee Services. The start date is the third Monday of August, 2025. The contract term is 24 months. Then create an order based on this contract. The order start date should be the first working day of September, 2025.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Create the contract:
  - Open App Launcher > View All > Contracts, then click New.
  - Set Account to “Lee Services” (select the suggested record).
  - Set Start Date to 08/18/2025 (third Monday of August 2025).
  - Set Contract Term (months) to 24.
  - Save the contract.
- Create the order based on the contract:
  - Open App Launcher > View All > Orders, then click New Order.
  - Set Account to “Lee Services” (select the record).
  - Set Order Start Date to 09/02/2025 (first working day of September 2025).
  - In Contract Number, select the Lee Services contract created above.
  - Save the order.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Could you take care of the Knight LLC account for me? Build a 12‑month contract that begins today. After that’s created, open an order from this contract and set its start date to be the next Friday after the contract’s start date.
```

query_templated: Create a new Sales Process named 'B2B' which only includes the following stages: Prospecting, Qualification, Closed Won, Closed Lost.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:I want to create a new Sales Process named "B2B", which only includes the "Prospecting", Qualification", "Closed Won", and "Closed Lost" values.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce, open Setup.
- Navigate: Feature Settings > Sales > Sales Processes.
- Click New Sales Process.
- Enter Sales Process Name: B2B, then click Save to open the stage selection page.
- Configure included stages by removing all unwanted stages so only these remain: Prospecting, Qualification, Closed Won, Closed Lost.
  - Remove: Needs Analysis, Value Proposition, Id. Decision Makers, Perception Analysis, Proposal/Price Quote, Negotiation/Review.
- Click Save to finalize the B2B sales process.
Sample 2:
TASK:Our small to medium-sized business team needs a new Sales Process called "SMB Sales", which only includes the "Prospecting", "Value Proposition", "Negotiation/Review", "Closed Won", and "Closed Lost" values.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the “SMB Sales” Sales Process with only the required stages:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Use Quick Find to search for “Sales Processes” and open it.
- Click “New” to create a Sales Process.
- Enter “SMB Sales” as the Sales Process Name and click Save.
- In the stage selection screen, keep only these values: Prospecting, Value Proposition, Negotiation/Review, Closed Won, Closed Lost.
  - Remove the following values:
    - Qualification
    - Needs Analysis
    - Id. Decision Makers
    - Perception Analysis
    - Proposal/Price Quote
- Click Save to finalize the Sales Process.

## Your ultimate task
```
Go ahead and spin up a Sales Process called 'B2B' with exactly these stages—and nothing else: Prospecting, Qualification, Closed Won, Closed Lost.
```

ground_truth_dict.comma_separated_stages_list: Prospecting, Qualification, Closed Won, Closed Lost
