query_templated: Create a territory model named 'by revenue' with rule name 'annual revenue is USD'. Set the selection criteria as 'annual revenue is greater than 10,000'. Enable sales territory if not already enabled.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a territory model with the name "by revenue" and the rule name "annual revenue is USD". The selection criteria is "annual revenue is greater than 10,000". If the sales territory is not enabled, enable it first.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in and open Setup.
- Navigate to Feature Settings > Sales > Territories > Territory Settings, and enable Sales Territory (if not already enabled).
- Use Quick Find to search for “Territory Models” and open it.
- Create a new territory model:
  - Click New Territory Model.
  - Set Territory Model Label to “by revenue”.
  - Save.
- Create the rule:
  - Click View Rules, then New Rule.
  - Set Rule Name to “annual revenue is USD”.
  - Set Field to “Account: Annual Revenue”, Operator to “greater than”, and Value to “10000”.
  - Check Set as Active.
  - Save.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a territory model with the name "by Employees" and with the rule name "Number of Employees and Year". The selection criteria is "total employees is less than or equal to 50" and "account year started is greater than or equal to 2020". If the sales territory is not enabled, enable it first.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Territory” and open “Territory Models.”
- Create the model:
  - Click “New Territory Model.”
  - Enter label: “by Employees.”
  - Click “Save.”
- Add the rule:
  - Click “View Rules,” then “New Rule.”
  - Enter rule name: “Number of Employees and Year.”
  - Add condition 1: Field = “Account: Employees”; Operator = “less or equal”; Value = “50.”
  - Add condition 2: Field = “Account: Year”; Operator = “greater or equal”; Value = “2020.”
  - Check “Set as Active.”
  - Click “Save.”

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
- Enabling Sales Territories was not required in this run (already enabled).

## Your ultimate task
```
Spin up a new territory model called 'by revenue'. Give its rule the name 'annual revenue is USD'. Filter the selection to accounts where annual revenue is greater than 10,000. If sales territory isn’t enabled yet, please enable it.
```

query_templated: Create a new campaign with following details - Name: Introduce the new shoes collections; type: Webinar; Start Date: two weeks from today; Budget: 10000; Expected Revenue in Campaign: 10 times the budget. Finally, invite the following leads to this campaign: Ali Alaba and Leo Messi
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a new campaign with following details. [name: Introduce the new shoes collections; type: Webinar; Start Date: two weeks from today; Budget: 10,000; Expected Revenue in Campaign: 10 times the Budget.] Finally, invite the following leads to this campaign: [Ali Alaba and Leo Messi]
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the campaign and invite leads:

1) Log in and navigate to create a new campaign
- Click “Log In”
- Click “Campaigns” > “New”

2) Enter campaign details
- Campaign Name: “Introduce the new shoes collections”
- Type: Select “Webinar” from the Type dropdown
- Start Date: Set to two weeks from today (entered as 09/01/2025 in the run)
- Budget cost in Campaign: 10,000
- Expected Revenue in Campaign: 100,000 (10x the budget)
- Click “Save”

3) Invite leads to the campaign
- Click “Add Leads”
- Select checkboxes for “Ali Alaba” and “Leo Messi”
- Click “Next”
- Click “Submit”

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:￼
Create a new campaign with following details. [name: Autumn Trail Running Launch; type: Direct Mail; Start Date: four weeks from today; Budget: 10,000; Expected Revenue in Campaign: 3 times the Budget.] Invite the following lead to this campaign: [Amanda Klein]
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the campaign and invite the lead:

- Log in to the app.
- Navigate to Campaigns and click New.
- Enter campaign details:
  - Campaign Name: Autumn Trail Running Launch
  - Type: open the Type dropdown, scroll, and select Direct Mail
  - Start Date: 09/15/2025 (four weeks from the date used in the trajectory)
  - Expected Revenue in Campaign: 30,000
  - Budgeted Cost in Campaign: 10,000
- Click Save.

query_templated: Create a queue with name "Shoe Case Support". Only send email to members under the distribution list "support.shoe@papaltd.com". Add the Object "Customer". Include "Role: Customer Support, North America" as the Member.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create a Queue with the name "Shoe Case Support". Only send email to members under the distribution list "support.shoe@papaltd.com". Add the Object "Customer". Include "Role: Customer Support, North America" as the Member.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in and open Setup.
- Navigate to Users > Queues.
- Click New Queue.
- Configure the queue:
  - Queue Label: Shoe Case Support.
  - Queue Email: support.shoe@papaltd.com.
- Add supported object:
  - Select Customer and click Add to Selected Objects.
- Add members:
  - In Queue Members, choose Role, select Role: Customer Support, North America, and click Add to Selected Members.
- Save the queue.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create a Queue with the name "VIP Support". Add the Object "Buyer Group". Include "Role: SVP, Customer Service & Support" and "Role: Customer Support, International" as the Members.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the Queue:

- Log in and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Queues” and select Queues.
- Click “New Queue.”
- Enter Queue Label: “VIP Support” (Queue Name auto-fills).
- Scroll to Supported Objects, select “Buyer Group,” and click “Add” to move it to Selected Objects.
- In Queue Members, set the filter to “Roles.”
- From Available Members, select “Role: SVP, Customer Service & Support” and click “Add to Selected Members.”
- Select “Role: Customer Support, International” and click “Add to Selected Members.”
- Click “Save.”

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Create a queue named "Shoe Case Support." Limit notification emails so they go only to the "support.shoe@papaltd.com" distribution list. Add the Customer object, and add the role "Customer Support, North America" as a member.
```

query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Help me with creating a case assignment rule named 'Billing Cases Assignment Rule' by assigning cases whose description contains the keyword 'billing' or whose case number starts with 5 to billing support queue. The first condition has higher priority to be evaluated.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Case Assignment Rules” and open it.
- Create a new rule:

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:We need to create a case record for Alice Bob regarding her account access issue. The case status should be 'Working' and the case originated from an email. Set the priority to High, type to 'Other', case reasoning to 'Equipment Design', subject to 'Account Access Denied - Password Reset Required'.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the case:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open App Launcher, search for “cases”, and open the Cases app/list.
- Click “New Case” to open the case creation form.
- Set Contact Name: search/select “Alice Bob”.
- Set required fields via dropdowns:
  - Status: Working
  - Priority: High
  - Case Origin: Email
  - Type: Other
  - Case Reason: Equipment Design
- Scroll to the Subject field and enter: “Account Access Denied - Password Reset Required”.
- Click “Save” to create the case.
Sample 2:
TASK:Please create a case record for Ethan Parker about a network connectivity problem. The case status should be 'New' and the case originated from a phone call. Set the priority to Medium, type to 'Electrical', case reasoning to 'Installation', subject to 'Network Connectivity Issues - Router Configuration'.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open the App Launcher, search for “cases,” and open the Cases app/list.
- Click “New Case.”
- Set Contact to “Ethan Parker.”
- Set Type to “Electrical.”
- Set Case Reason to “Installation.”
- Set Case Origin to “Phone.”
- Scroll if needed and enter Subject: “Network Connectivity Issues - Router Configuration.”
- Click “Save.”

Notes:
- No hotkeys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Hey, can you make a case for David Kim about a hardware malfunction? Set the status to 'Escalated', mark the origin as a phone call, set priority to High, type to 'Mechanical', case reasoning to 'Equipment Design', and use the subject 'Hardware Malfunction - Warranty Replacement'.
```

query_templated: According to the service level agreement (SLA), the Old Balance account has the Phone Support entitlement, which starts a week from today and expires in 1 year. Create an entitlement record named Standard Phone Support for me.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:According to the service level agreement (SLA), the Old Balance account has the Phone Support entitlement, which starts a week from today and expires in 1 year. Create an entitlement record named Standard Phone Support for me.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan to create the entitlement record

- Log in to Salesforce.
- Open the App Launcher, search for “Entitlements,” and open the Entitlements app/list.
- Click New to create a new entitlement.
- Enter Entitlement Name: “Standard Phone Support.”
- Set Account Name: search for “Old Balance” and select the matching account from the lookup results.
- Set Start Date to one week from today (in this run: 08/26/2025).
- Set End Date to one year after the start date (in this run: 08/26/2026).
- Click Save.

query_templated: To improve the customer service quality, we defined a new entitlement process with four milestones. The first milestone named 'acknowledgment' should be non-recurring and tracks initial acknowledgment time. The second milestone named 'analysis' is sequential-recurring and tracks problem analysis time. The third milestone named 'solution' is non-recurring and tracks solution development time. The fourth milestone named 'verification' is independent-recurring and tracks solution verification time.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:To improve the customer service quality, we defined a new entitlement process with four milestones. The first milestone named "Acknowledgement" should be "non-recurring" and "Tracks initial acknowledgement time". The second milestone named "Analysis" is "sequential-recurring" and "Tracks problem analysis time". The third milestone named "Solution" is "non-recurring" and "Tracks solution development time". The fourth milestone named "Verification" is "independent-recurring" and "Tracks solution verification time".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce, open Setup.
- In Quick Find, type “Milestones” and open the Milestones page.
- Create milestones as follows:
  - Acknowledgement:
    - Name: Acknowledgement
    - Recurrence Type: No Recurrence (non-recurring)
    - Description: Tracks initial acknowledgement time
    - Save & New
  - Analysis:
    - Name: Analysis
    - Recurrence Type: Sequential (sequential-recurring)
    - Description: Tracks problem analysis time
    - Save & New
  - Solution:
    - Name: Solution
    - Recurrence Type: No Recurrence (non-recurring)
    - Description: Tracks solution development time
    - Save & New
  - Verification:
    - Name: Verification
    - Recurrence Type: Independent (independent-recurring)
    - Description: Tracks solution verification time
    - Save

Notes:
- Save & New was used to streamline creation for the first three milestones; Save used for the last.
- No hotkeys were used.
Sample 2:
TASK:To improve the customer service quality, we defined a new entitlement process with two milestones. The first milestone named "Assessment" should be "independent-recurring" and "Tracks initial assessment time". The second milestone named "Delivery" is "non-recurring" and "Tracks final delivery time".
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for “Entitlement Management” and go to “Milestones.”
- Create milestone “Assessment”:
  - Name: Assessment
  - Recurrence Type: Independent (independent-recurring)
  - Description: Tracks initial assessment time
  - Click “Save & New”
- Create milestone “Delivery”:
  - Name: Delivery
  - Recurrence Type: No Recurrence (non-recurring)
  - Description: Tracks final delivery time
  - Click “Save”

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.
- “Save & New” was used to efficiently add the second milestone after the first.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please create a new entitlement process to boost our support standards. It needs four milestones: - "acknowledgment" — set this to non-recurring and measure the time until we first acknowledge the case. - "analysis" — configure as sequential-recurring and track the time spent analyzing the problem. - "solution" — make this non-recurring and capture the time it takes to develop the solution. - "verification" — set as independent-recurring and monitor the time required to verify the solution.
```

The fourth milestone named 'verification' is independent-recurring and tracks solution verification time

query_templated: Create an entitlement process with the name Priority Customer Support for the Case records. The case should enter this process based on case created date and exit when it is closed. Include the milestone 'first response to priority customers', which gives the agent 30 mins to provide first response to priority customers.
query:
## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:Create an entitlement process with the name "Priority Customer Support" for the Case records. The case should enter this process based on the case created date and exit when it is closed. Include the milestone "first response to priority customers" at order 1, which gives the agent 30 minutes to provide first response to priority customers.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in, open Setup.
- In Quick Find, search for and open “Entitlement Processes”.
- Click “New Entitlement Process”.
- Select the Case object for the entitlement process and click “Next”.
- Enter Entitlement Process Name: “Priority Customer Support”.
- Leave default timing: case enters based on Created Date and exits when Case is closed.
- Save the entitlement process.
- Click “New Milestone”.
- Set Milestone Name: “first response to priority customers”.
- Set Order: 1.
- Set Time Trigger: 30 minutes.
- Save the milestone.
Sample 2:
TASK:Create an entitlement process with the name "Premium Support Process" for the Case records. The case should enter this process based on the case created date and exit when it is closed. Include the milestone "first response to priority customers" at order 1, which gives the agent 15 minutes to provide initial response to premium customers.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan summary:

- Log in to Salesforce and open Setup.
- Use Quick Find to search for “Entitlement Processes” and open it.
- Click “New Entitlement Process,” select Case as the process object in the wizard, and click Next.
- Enter Entitlement Process Name: “Premium Support Process.”
- Configure the process to start based on Case Created Date and exit when the Case is closed, then Save.
- Click “New Milestone” to add a milestone to the process:
  - Milestone Name: “first response to priority customers”
  - Order: 1
  - Time Trigger: 15 minutes
  - Save

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

## Your ultimate task
```
Please set up an entitlement process called “Priority Customer Support” for Case records. Start the process based on the Case Created Date and have it end when the case is closed. Add a milestone named “first response to priority customers” that gives agents 30 minutes to send the first response to priority customers.
```

query_template_metadata.template_string: Create an entitlement process with the name {process_name} for the {record_type} records. The {entry_condition}. Include {milestone_details}. {violation_action}.

instance_dict.entry_condition: case should enter this process based on case created date and exist when it is closed
instance_dict.milestone_details: the milestone 'first response to priority customers', which gives the agent 30 mins to provide first response to priority customers
instance_dict.violation_action: Add the warning action to set time trigger 5 minutes before first response to priority customers

query_templated: Create a knowledge article and publish it. The title should be Headlight Replacement with the question description be "How can I safely replace a malfunctioning car headlight on my own, including steps for removal, installation, and precautions to avoid damage?". The answer should be "To replace a malfunctioning car headlight, first park your vehicle on level ground, turn off the ignition, and open the hood. Locate the headlight housing behind the light assembly. Disconnect the power connector by gently pulling it off, then remove the dust cover if present. Release the bulb by undoing the retaining clip or turning it counterclockwise. Avoid touching the glass of the new bulb with bare fingers, as oils may shorten its lifespan; hold it by the base instead. Insert the new bulb securely, reattach the clip and cover, then reconnect the wiring. Finally, turn on the headlights to confirm proper operation.".

## Similar task and experience

Sample 1:
TASK:After an intensive investigation, the root cause for the incident 'network connectivity failures across regional offices' is found. We need to create a change request with the following details. Subject: upgrade network infrastructure, Description: implement redundant network connections to prevent future connectivity issues, Priority: High, Impact: Low, Risk Level: Medium. Link this change request to the incident case and update the incident status to in progress.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan

- Log in to the system.
- Open the App Launcher, search for “Incidents,” and navigate to the Incidents app/record.
- On the incident record, open the Related tab.
- In the Change Requests related list, click New Change Request, then select Add New Change Request if prompted. (Creating from the incident’s Related tab automatically links the change request to this incident.)
- Populate fields:
  - Subject: Upgrade network infrastructure
  - Description: Implement redundant network connections to prevent future connectivity issues
  - Priority: High
  - Impact: Low
  - Risk Level: Medium
- Save the change request. If a confirmation save is prompted, click Save again.
- Update the incident status:
  - Click Edit Incident Status
  - Set Status to In Progress
  - Click Save

Notes
- No hot-keys were used in the successful execution.
Sample 2:
TASK:After an intensive investigation, the root cause for the incident 'security breach in user authentication system' is found. We need to create a change request with the following details. Subject: enhance security protocols, Description: implement multi-factor authentication and security monitoring tools, Priority: Moderate, Impact: Medium, Risk Level: Low. Link this change request to the incident case and update the incident status to closed.
EXPERIENCE:
Successful plan:

- Log in to the platform.
- Open App Launcher, search for “Incidents,” and open the Incidents app/list.
- Open the target incident and switch to the Related tab.
- In the Change Requests related list, create a new change request (Add New Change Request), which links it to the incident automatically.
- Populate fields:
  - Subject: Enhance security protocols
  - Description: Implement multi-factor authentication and security monitoring tools.
  - Priority: Moderate
  - Impact: Medium
  - Risk Level: Low
- Save the change request.
- Edit the incident, set Status to Closed, and save.

Notes:
- No hot-keys were used.

```
After an intensive investigation, the root cause for the incident 'authentication service outage affecting enterprise applications' is found.
```
